Params: {3: 'On the other end of Eden 16-B Leisure Module.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'The results of the scan show that... the area is calm. Not even a single trace of the regular programs is detected.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: '...That seems a little out of the ordinary. I suggest proceeding with caution. Is there a way to bypass this area?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "I can continue searching, but I'll need time...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Retrieving external data... Babylonia is still falling. It's now very close to the bottom of low Earth orbit.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Babylonia isn't designed to navigate through the stratosphere. If the altitude is too low, navigational functions will begin to malfunction...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Even if we abandon Babylonia, there won't be enough time to evacuate the whole ship...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Disregarding any anti-air weaponry on the surface that can damage Babylonia, the forced landing itself could kill at least a fourth of the passengers.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'We have to stop it from crash landing.', 3: '20'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "If we force our way through, even though it won't impact us Constructs, it will pose a risk to you, Commandant.", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "But I also agree that there's no time to waste.", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "In that case, I'll take point. Lee will cover the rear. Commandant, you'll be safer in the back.", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Being hit in virtual space won't be fatal, but disconnecting is still excruciating for humans.", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "If a Construct dies... they can still be repaired if the damage isn't beyond the reboot threshold.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "So... We can't afford to lose you, Commandant.", 4: '3'}
{3: 'Defense programs disguised as Terrapod guards patrol the area as usual.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: "Looks like they don't pose much of a threat.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'We all have an ID code from Babylonia. We should be okay.', 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "It seems that we can't pass here without a fight!", 4: '3'}
